data = array(samples)
print(data.shape)
Listing 6.21: Example of printing the shape of the samples.
Running this piece, you should see that we have 25 rows and 200 columns. Interpreted in a
machine learning context, this dataset has 25 samples and 200 features per sample.
(25, 200)
Listing 6.22: Example output from printing the shape of the samples.
Next, we can use the reshape() function to add one additional dimension for our single
feature and use the existing columns as time steps instead.
